website_summaries.verdict: An extremely affordable bed tray that's simple to use, yet highly functional and well-made.
pros: We love how the folding design offers extra easy storage and excellent portability
Solidly constructed from pine and melamine, which is easy to clean
Good handle placement for easy carrying
cons: Some users say it collapses too easily in certain circumstances

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy, you can't return the item.
customer_reviews.text: The legs will not lock and can easily cause you to spill the items on the tray. You can't return this item. It appears to be sold by Amazon but they say to contact the manufacturer. This is the response I received from the manufacturer: "For any returns you will need to contact retailer whom item was purchased through." I replied: "They told me to contact you. Aren't you the manufacturer?" And the manufacturer replied: "Yes we are the manufacturer. Item wasn’t purchase through us so we can't take returns. You need to let retailer know they need to arrange a return to refund your money." The classic runaround.
customer_reviews.author: rickmont

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as I imagined
customer_reviews.text: I received my table today. I am pleased with it. I had some concern when ordering that the white surface would be flimsy; it is not. The surface is a lightweight board but it does not flex and solidly holds my items. I would buy another if I ever need two. I've attached a photo of my table with coffee and a bowl of raspberries. I think it would work fine for any breakfast items or a laptop computer :)
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: and new I was going to be laid up in bed for a number of days and wanted to be as comfortable as possible
customer_reviews.text: I just had a tonsillectomy, and new I was going to be laid up in bed for a number of days and wanted to be as comfortable as possible. I also didn't want to spend a lot of money on something as I'm hoping I don't have much need for it once I am recovered. It's perfect. Light weight, which is important as I'm not allowed to life much. Easy to wipe clean. The height and size is also great. Not too big and not too small. It fits a colouring book and pencils with just enough room. Just right for this goldilocks.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Allaker

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: The table came with stains on it. And the legs are loose, keeps collapsing on me.
customer_reviews.author: mochi

customer_reviews.title: major disappointment
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for the same product that I purchased in 1/2012, I used that one every day with no problems, I recently chipped a piece of wood from the frame and decided to get a new one. I can't believe the difference in quality. Within 30 days, the legs started to collapse in on themselves when I had it open. Messy and possibly dangerous if you had food on the tray. I returned it to Amazon and replaced it. I've had the replacement less than 30 days. First, the closed legs started to fall down and would not stay closed. Now the legs have started to collapse in on themselves when I have it open. Awful product.
customer_reviews.author: ktgnewjersey

customer_reviews.title: I should have listen to the bad reviews. Its nicely made with wood
customer_reviews.text: I dont understand how anyone can use this? I should have listen to the bad reviews. Its nicely made with wood, i will give that. but i will say that the biggest drawback is the legs 1. its not polished enough that it is easy to get splinters on your hands. 2. it COLLAPSE TOO EASILY. Unless you are EXTREMELY careful with it (careful meaning, not touching it at all), it just collapses while eating. If you need this for practical use, try something else.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awkward to use
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, but a bit heavy. Looks nice and easy to clean. However, it’s awkward to open the tray legs, especially if the tray is already loaded, for example if you carried it loaded from the kitchen. And then the legs do not lock open, and it’s too easy for one or the other leg to collapse — and there goes the breakfast! The tray would be perfect if the legs locked when opened.
customer_reviews.author: E. S.

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money on this tray!
customer_reviews.text: The wood is rough and prone to splintering with no varnish or oil and would be very uncomfortable to rest your arms while eating or working. The bottoms of the legs are poorly cut so they'll scratch or tear furniture, sheets, etc. The white tray looks nice but it's slick, flimsy and cheap so I wouldn't trust it to hold more than 1 or 2 pounds. The legs are not tight and swing down when you lift the tray; they don't lock open or closed. This is a cheap product that's made in China.
customer_reviews.author: Bob in NC

customer_reviews.title: Adequate. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: These are bed trays, not something for the dinner table. Overall, the construction is what it is for the price. The tray is adequate for its purpose, but the construction is sketchy. I'm a woodworker, so the first thing I noticed was the finish. Globs of polyurethane on the handles and parts had no finish on it. The joints are not tight so I'll probably in time to come have to reassemble correctly. In the end, you get what you pay for. These will work for days when kids are sick and want to eat in bed. Or, my kids will use them to put their devices on and watch whatever on sick days.
customer_reviews.author: tcrain1

customer_reviews.title: Very light.
customer_reviews.text: This tray is not heavy at all. It is very light. This takes away from the sturdiness so you have to decide what you want more. Light to carry or sturdy when using. The slightest bump and the tray will move and the legs don’t lock in place. It’s the only reason I didn’t give it 5 stars. That being said. It works well. It does the job. Has a surface that cleans easily. It’s priced right right.
customer_reviews.author: Rob R.

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and in undamaged condition - thanks Prime. These trays are outstanding. I intend to replace the rivets holding the legs on with nuts & bolts and will add a rod to lock the legs in the open position when used. We had these same trays years ago when our grandchildren were growing up and they are using them now with their children. Great buy and great versatility.
customer_reviews.author: wudbuchr

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality!
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this tray is poor. It looks like some of the wood is bad. The corners don't look right. One is jagged because the wood doesn't fit exactly together. And one of the legs flops down because it's slightly loose. Amazon was gracious to issue a refund to me after I was unable to get ahold of Winsome Wood directly. Would not recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Angloculby

customer_reviews.title: Legs do not lock
customer_reviews.text: We have had several accidents with the legs folding when using. The tray is great and easy to clean but if you are using it with the legs extended, it could be a disaster. I am going to keep it, but using it only as a tray. It wouldn't have taken the company much more to make the legs stable.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: The legs don’t have anything to hold them in place, both when folded up for storage and when out for use. Makes the tray virtually useless as they hang straight down when you’re carrying it and when you set it down they tend to buckle inward and the whole thing falls over. You have to have an extra arm or another person help you. And they fall open when you’re trying to store it. So dumb. Also cheaply made and annoyingly hard to clean. Absolutely would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lars Hayne

customer_reviews.title: Good value-
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews that said this product was not put together well. I guess I got a good one! The only problem I had was one of the fold up legs kept slipping and wouldn’t stay folded... I fixed that quickly... It works perfectly for this late night snacks in bed (don’t judge me! LOL)
customer_reviews.author: Joyful One

customer_reviews.title: Pretty awesome - great price!
customer_reviews.text: I am a teacher and needed a small work space to put my computer while working remotely from home. I read so many reviews on other items and decided to take a chance on this one, I'm glad I did. This is perfect for what I need, it is very sturdy and I can fold it down to a tray when I need to eat dinner. No, I don't have dining table or other work space here.
customer_reviews.author: AnnieDoll

customer_reviews.title: Be Careful!!  Very splintery and not well made.
customer_reviews.text: Wood was not sanded properly before they stained it and it is very splintery. Can not use it until I buy some sand paper to sand down all of the sharp edges and purchase another glaze to spray over it. Very disappointed to have to spend more money just to be able to use it.
customer_reviews.author: The Wrights

customer_reviews.title: Wished I got this sooner.
customer_reviews.text: Best investment ever. Good build quality. I have a nice setup in my room with multiple couches. I dont have a table or anything, so this was really helpful when eating in my room while watching Netflix or Youtube. Other than food, I use my laptop on here as well! Its very easy to fold and unfold. Has handlebars for easy pick up. Helpful Tip: When using my laptop, the charge port is on the side. That said, I insert the charging cable through the handlebar hole to make it easier and not worry about the cable in the way or w.e!
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: We like this tray. We use it every day.
customer_reviews.text: We like this tray. We use it every day. It is easy to set up on my daughter's bed and it stays up. After cleanup, it stores flat under her bed until we need it again. Please do not let complainers, who seem to want this try to have tighter legs or spring loaded legs, scare you into buying a heavier, more expensive tray. I am not made out of money and I do not need fancy. This is a good item, it is light weight, it is at a good price and it does what it was designed to do.
customer_reviews.author: JTrahanUSATop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not too shabby, but not the best either...
customer_reviews.text: They do their job, I have 2 of these so I got them at a discounted rate. I will say they legs have nothing to secure them in place up or down and that can be annoying. This is especially true because on one of my tables one of the legs is completely free to fall if it is lifted up so keeping it flat while trying to set down a full tray can be troublesome...
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Did someone say breakfast in bed?!?
customer_reviews.text: this tray is perfect for breakfast in bed. I cut up my fruits and put it on the tray for when i want to watch the news and have a snack in the morning in bed. it is proper height to let your legs go under the tray, and the tray itself is well constructed. My only gripe is that the legs do not lock out, so it you move the tray right or left too much one of the legs may fold in. otherwise its a very nice tray, and works well
customer_reviews.author: GERI

customer_reviews.title: Legs keep flopping down
customer_reviews.text: After a few uses, the legs keep flopping down. Several times now (over the last few weeks), I've had to hammer the rivets down.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D. Newell

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made, not durable
customer_reviews.text: Legs do not lock into place so it’s easily collapsible, which can be messy. I bought five of these for gifts for Christmas for my family & two have torn up already, the wood just broke off when picking it up. Top is white so stains easily. I guess this is why they’re so mich cheaper than the other brands
customer_reviews.author: Kelzeduc8s

customer_reviews.title: This Tray Is Exactly What I Needed
customer_reviews.text: I use this to serve food to my bedridden spouse. I like the hand grips, and the melamine surface. I don't use the legs much because I serve the meal on a bed table. However, they retract into a flat rim so the tray always sits evenly.
customer_reviews.author: Georgette Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Nice, sturdy and looks great. Can not complain with the price. There are 2 things I would change. First, If you put your plate on it and move, it will slide. I almost lost my spaghetti. I am going to get a rubber mat to hold the plate. Second, if you sit in bed the table leans back with your weight, it needs adjustable legs and when you are trying to put it away the legs keep unfolding. I will remanufacture both of those this weekend.
customer_reviews.author: Willie Radford

customer_reviews.title: So easy to set up every morning
customer_reviews.text: My 2.5 year old son eats breakfast in our bed every morning while we get ready for work (I know, how lucky for him!). Before this, we were using a towel to catch any breakfast spills (cereal, oatmeal, fruit). This is a total game changer for us. So easy to set up every morning...and fold down to store in between the bed and nightstand table. It is low enough so a little toddler can still see over a regular glass bowl that is sitting on top of the tray. This has made our mornings (and laundry) so much easier!!! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley M.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the price
customer_reviews.text: Goes perfect with me Parisian vibe. Aside from everything else ordered recently this arrived promptly. I love the light color wood and did not have to put it together, It arrived already assembled. I’ve only had it for 2 days so hopefully it doesn’t fall apart otherwise I’ll edit my review. I gave it 4 stars because on some areas of the wood it did have some edges that needed to be sanded otherwise I would’ve gotten splinters. Perfect for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Nati

customer_reviews.title: Repurchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought this two years ago and it was only $15! I was looking to replace mine, which died of a self-inflicted wound: I put too much pressure on it, leaning on it to get out of bed. Don't do that! The current $15 version that Amazon carries doesn't have the handles, which are essential. I read the reviews of the other similar products, but none of them stand out as better. I do like the white melamine surface, which easily wipes clean.
customer_reviews.author: Merle K. NYC

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money, legs are a little floppy for the unhandy folks.
customer_reviews.text: Edit: Keeping my word, I upgraded my review and fixed the legs. See the attached pictures to see what I did. Now the legs can be tightened and loosened to whatever I want. A good product for the money. The rivets that hold the legs are variable as far as how well they stay in the stowed position. I will probably drill out the rivets and replace with machine screws and locknuts...but I am highly skilled at that stuff, the average schmuck cant do that. Once I upgrade to that modification this will be a 5 star product for the money. I will be buying at least one more.
customer_reviews.author: Dude

customer_reviews.title: Nice, easy clean up, just what I was looking for, however,
customer_reviews.text: How difficult would it have been for the manufacturer to put an elbow lock on each end? Just one per leg would do it! What we have here is a breakfast tray that folds up and spills breakfast and a hot beverage all over you and the bedding! Seriously, just look at all the trays and you'll see most are made the same way. I'm feeling rather ripped off and have to get a handyman out to fix this.
customer_reviews.author: constant reader

customer_reviews.title: This is a great tray. It works perfectly for me as a ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tray. It works perfectly for me as a laptop table when sitting in my easy chair or a bed tray for dotting on the sick loved one or for those special breakfast in bed moments. I like that fact that the surface is sturdy enough that it supports things very well, in essence it doesn't flex on you while carrying it with things on it. A big plus! I found that if I spilled anything on it was contained and the surface cleaned very easily. It can be used with the legs down or in the folded position with ease. This is the perfect choice for my needs!
customer_reviews.author: AJ57

customer_reviews.title: whom is the most wonderful, generous
customer_reviews.text: Just recently had ankle surgery. Because I was not going to be able to move around a lot, we bought to use while I was stuck in bed. Now, anytime I need something, I simply call my slave...errr...husband, whom is the most wonderful, generous, and gracious person in the whole world, and he can lovingly bring it to me. I am able to easily use it in bed as a table to eat from and keep the mess to a minimum. I also use it as a small table in bed for my tablet and laptop.
customer_reviews.author: alexward001

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality not worth the money!!
customer_reviews.text: The legs are not sturdy at all, very wobbly, and falls extremely easily which defeats the purpose of it. Tried to submit a return and they give you the option of a support website and a phone number to call. Called the number only to be told the line was busy and try back later. Do not waste your time on this!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tray is sturdy, handles are comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Tray is sturdy, handles are comfortable, easy to clean and store, and table sits at good height when legs are down. The only thing that I'd change is that there be some sort of lock on the legs when in use. I was constantly worried that the legs would collapse with any movement under them, to the point that I'd hold onto the tray just in case it fell. Some sort of precaution against that would be nice.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Not eligible for return
customer_reviews.text: If you buy this, you're stuck with it. I found it unwieldy and it doesn't stay up very well. But, it's mine because it's not eligible to return.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Table w One Flaw
customer_reviews.text: This table is nice in all aspects except the legs do not stay folded up when table not in use and stored. Every time I fold the legs up, they just fall right back down again. I finally put velcro on the legs and table to hold the legs in place when storing or carrying in folded position. That is working great. The table is a nice table otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Diana G.

customer_reviews.title: Great Bed Tray!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bed tray. I brought it for my mom who is bedridden. It works great for her. It’s sturdy and I love how I can fold it up to put it away. I am going to buy me one!!! It was a reasonable price too!!!
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly perfect for couch work!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this breakfast tray for both teleworking (for my laptop), as well as eating. It’s very sturdy and well-made. Easy to clean, the perfect size if you need to use your laptop and a notebook on it. would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sasha718

customer_reviews.title: Surface could be more durable otherwise great
customer_reviews.text: The surface is not easily wipeable and it stained after my kids coloring Pens bled through the paper. I would’ve liked a less porous surface otherwise perfectly functionable and works great
customer_reviews.author: Tangled mess

customer_reviews.title: I got major Grandma points for this!
customer_reviews.text: Older grandson fell on the younger, age 6...broken arm for the little guy with 6 weeks in an immobilizing sling. I bought this tray for him. He's not an invalid, but only using only one arm was crimping his style. He loves this tray. Just the right height, strong, sturdy, and stable with ample surface to accommodate his iPad...games, books, snacks, whatever. It folds flat to store.. He uses it on the couch, on the floor, and yes, on his bed. His mother put a thin non-skid mat on it in case of small bumps. A good price for an attractive, quality product. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: ResQMee

customer_reviews.title: Good Meal Trays
customer_reviews.text: These are great. The only issue I have with them is that the legs are not too firm so when you carry it they flop open and swing back and forth. I've seen others where the legs were more fixed and wouldn't open unless you pulled them open I like the sturdy feeling wood and they seem to be good quality overall.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Berry

customer_reviews.title: These "looked" like what we were replacing so I didn't
customer_reviews.text: Legs swing too freely. If you don't manually balance legs, they will collapse. I, almost always, read reviews. These "looked" like what we were replacing so I didn't.
customer_reviews.author: jam

customer_reviews.title: Great Sturdy Lightweight Tray
customer_reviews.text: I bought this breakfast tray to be able to do my make up in bed under the blankets on cold winter mornings and it works perfectly. Each morning I bring it up and place my mirror and make up tray on it and do my make up in comfort. This tray is sturdy but light. The legs flip in and out easily. It also works great to work on my laptop in bed as well. I would see this being very useful post surgery if you were stuck in bed for a while or if you are someone who loves comfort like me, it is useful for many daily activities in the comfort of your own bed.
customer_reviews.author: Jess Mo

customer_reviews.title: Not Stable as a table
customer_reviews.text: Probably my fault for not reading comments and specs correctly. I'm disappointed that there is no way to keep the legs open when they are extended. The table sways and collapses, so it's not good for a writing table, laptop use or eating on. I only rated it three stars because for now I can use some duck tape (yes! it fixes everything!) to keep the legs up. I will probably find some really strong glue for a permanent fix. YES! It will store easier with the legs folded in...but it's not usable without stable support
customer_reviews.author: S. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as pictured
customer_reviews.text: I really like this, just what I was looking for. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because the box was damaged upon arrival and that caused a crack in the underside of tray. So glad it didn’t happen on the top!
customer_reviews.author: Angela Caminiti

customer_reviews.title: Great for Kids!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 3 grand kids to eat on, when they come over. I do not have a dining table and I didn't like making them just eat from their laps, so I purchased the bed trays for them. They love them! Each kid has their own tray and they love them.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Okay, but lower quality than previous version
customer_reviews.text: This new item is okay, but noticeably lower quality than the previous similar-appearing tray table with handles. Previous item (brand name Goodwood, made in Thailand) had more substantial wood members with better finish, better fasteners, and wood backing on underside of plastic tray surface. That item performed well for years (decades?), but unfortunately got mildew damage. This item (brand name Winsome, made in China) has sharp tool marks on handles (ouch), cheaper fasteners and no wood backing on plastic tray.
customer_reviews.author: In Vino Veritas

customer_reviews.title: Decent Table, Just Not For Me
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could like it more! I initially thought it would be a great table to eat and use my laptop on, but I find that it's a bit too low and the angle too awkward. Additionally, the one sent to me had some rough patches that weren't sanded down enough (I didn't get any splinters, but it should've been sanded down more!) and I find the legs a bit too weak (it keeps sliding down). All in all, it's an okay product worth the price, and it definitely does the job, but these tiny little defects made me realize that I'm better off with another, albeit more expensive, bed table.
customer_reviews.author: glasuri

customer_reviews.title: This tray looks like it was assembled using the wood from multiple older ...
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this tray is very disappointing. I had a similar tray for years that was well assemble and looked uniform and clean. This tray looks like it was assembled using the wood from multiple older trays--none of the wood pieces are the same color or finish and the edges/corners do not come together evenly. The tray surface is flat and scuffed looking, unlike the tray I had used for years. It appears obvious that the nail holes have been tampered with because they are scratched and irregular. I should have just paid a few extra dollars to get my replacement tray elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Slippery
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 5 stars but I didn’t want to and here’s why... the surface is slippery and it should be made with a surface that grips so the plate or other items don’t slip. I had to cut some material that keeps things from sliding.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN PELL

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Extremely Useful
customer_reviews.text: this try is a large tray, that is sturdy and has a surface on the inside that is easily cleaned and will go with any decor. I find this helpful for a variety of reasons, I can take several items to my Mother and make only one trip and she can use it to eat her meals in bed when she does not feel like getting up. When not used as a tray I place it in the middle of my table and put napkins, salt and pepper etc on it to keep things in place. Not the carved beauty of those I looked at prior to my purchase, but am glad I purchased a serviceable item.
customer_reviews.author: Dixie L. Ambrose

customer_reviews.title: It gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: It gets the job done, but it's not great. When set on the counter or any flat surface, it wobbles because the legs aren't even. The actual tray surface is made of hardboard of HDF, and not actual wood as I had (perhaps foolishly) assumed. This piece of HDF is also not perfectly flat, and it had a small crack in one of the corners. Finally, the surface was filthy out of the box. It had all manner of dirt and crusty stuff stuck to the white surface and I had to scrub it off. But, it works.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Good quality. Only problem I found is that the ...
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. Only problem I found is that the legs drop down to readily. Solved this by putting Velcro underneath to hold the legs in the folded position to make a lap tray. We use these trays in our chairs and the legs extended do not fit the width of the chair. Easy to clean. Before purchasing I debated whether to buy with/without the handles. Handles are definitely a plus - makes moving much easier. First bought one for husband & liked so much, ordered another one the next day, Amazon Prime had it delivered in 19 hours, 😆
customer_reviews.author: Lana Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Easy to clean surface and tray sides prevents items from sliding off. Fits over my husband's lap in the bed or in the chair for easy use. Well built.
customer_reviews.author: P. Howser

customer_reviews.title: Good product however slightly unstable
customer_reviews.text: Good product overall. Easy to clean. The only downside is the legs keeps folding making it unstable and risk of splilling things. If there was some kind of lock to hold the legs it would have been great product
customer_reviews.author: Sunny Archer

customer_reviews.title: 2 months of light use and it's broken.
customer_reviews.text: "Perfect. Sturdy and well made. Great for breakfast in bed." - I said in January, Now its the end of Feb and this thing is f'cked. The legs are wonky and the wooden border has come off, exposing the nails. I don't like breakfast in bed to be an extreme sport, and I intend to repair this tray with some wood glue/crazy glue, but it should have held up longer than 2 months! Also the way its made make it unclear how to tighten loose screws, there is nothing for a screw driver to grab onto just a smooth surface with no edges.
customer_reviews.author: logan

customer_reviews.title: Nice large study tray
customer_reviews.text: I’m very guilty of eating in bed far often than I should and with white sheets this is a necessity! Nice large study tray, can be uses with the legs folded out or not. However after have the tray legs folded out just teo or three times now when I lift the tray one of the legs seem to kind of hang...and I can’t seem to find a way to tighten it so it doesn’t fall.
customer_reviews.author: Esther Klijn

customer_reviews.title: The item came to me dirty with what looked like black ash (at first I ...
customer_reviews.text: The item came to me dirty with what looked like black ash (at first I thought it was mold until it wiped off) while it was still in the packaging. It is very high when I sit down so as I am sitting on the sofa, it comes up to my chest which makes it uncomfortable to eat. Perhaps it might be better for someone taller than 5'2". And the legs are not sturdy which makes moving up and down from your sitting position difficult. I need my husband to help me hold the legs in place while I sit back.
customer_reviews.author: bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Great for breakfast in bed!
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this for me after we had our little one and I was on bed rest. We have stairs in our house and I was pretty much confined to the bedroom upstairs which meant eating in bed. The tray is light enough to manage with one hand, but sturdy enough to hold tons of stuff. Easy to clean and unfold. I took off the 1 star because it came with a slight crack on one of the corners. The joint wasn't properly sealed. It's held up pretty well after almost 3 weeks of continuous use.
customer_reviews.author: New Mom

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not the style I ordered
customer_reviews.text: I gave 3 starts because I didn't get the tray I ordered. I already had 2 with handles on the sides that I love. I bought a 3rd and specifically search to find the same brand and style. The one I was sent it's a lighter wood finish and doesn't have the handles like the others. Other wise these tests are great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Serviceable small table
customer_reviews.text: We use this as a dinner tray in front of our pellet stove on those cold winter nights. It makes a great substitute for a kotatsu (heated Japanese table) and costs next to nothing. The top, with handles, is handsome and well made, while the legs are a little loose and not very heavy. The top surface appears to be Mylar or some kind of plastic laminate, but other reviewers say that it is painted wood. I can't tell. We have had no problems with spills and warpage. It seems to be inert and it cleans easily as if made of plastic. All in all, a good investment.
customer_reviews.author: Dale L. Housley

customer_reviews.title: Gave me a sliver!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY! I got a sliver within 2 minutes of taking this tray out of the box. The surface is not smooth at all. There's also random glue spots all over the wood. Maybe the tray I was sent was a dud, but I'm definitely returning it for a refund, not a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: HogwartsGrad

customer_reviews.title: Very nice and neat look
customer_reviews.text: Very nice and neat look. Tucks away easily. Also is great for a prayer or reading corner. I utilize the space underneath for my journals and books. I also use them with floor cushions. I have limited space so they also work out great for my makeup and because there is space underneath I just tuck my makeup underneath and away and it is really pretty with my mirror and perfume on top.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: legs keep wanting to go down on it, I bought it to watch tv in bed as I have several health issues that im not eeling well need to lay down or rest , I do like the price and the fact that tray has sides, but things slide around which is a quick fix but the legs I dont know what I'll do about that , my advice if you're not going to use it on a soft surface it would probably work , but soft surfaces get a better made one,
customer_reviews.author: Chilepepper

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Good value!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for RV, where we only use an outdoor table. Very nice! Great quality. This one is very large. Beware legs dont lock! Good value.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn P.

customer_reviews.title: This is great!
customer_reviews.text: I love this table!!! I ise this for everything but mostly my small business by decorating tumblers. I have thick legs and i fit comfortably under it with room to move. Great quality!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Little Tray
customer_reviews.text: After being placed on two weeks of bed rest, I purchased this tray. I have used it both for eating meals and working on the computer. I use a wireless keyboard and the tray also served as a great lap desk. It fit well over my body and I was able to rest my arms in a comfortable position. I have also used the tray for eating meals while sitting in an reclining chair. My only complaint would be that there is not a cup holder, but I don't want to be greedy. ; ) I would definitely recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Frost

customer_reviews.title: Worth It.
customer_reviews.text: Totally worth the price. They are a little shorter than I thought but are perfect for slumber parties.
customer_reviews.author: Mesha

customer_reviews.title: GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my daughter who said her wish is to have breakfast in bed on her birthday!! I have a few more weeks to plan it but cannot WAIT to use it. It came with the correct packaging (although to a wrong address..for some reason, amazon or UPS keeps delivering my packages to my OLD address without my approval and have let Amazon know and it has nothing to the with the product itself). The tray is as true to what you see in the picture and very light. The legs do not lock which I'm fine with and big enough to serve a full meal on it!!
customer_reviews.author: Raela

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! Sturdy and large enough for 1 big dish and a small dish and a cup (not too small and not too big). Perfect for breakfast in bed
customer_reviews.author: Miss Rana  K I Tannous

customer_reviews.title: A Great Work Tray
customer_reviews.text: This tray fits my needs perfectly. Since the legs fold completely in, it works good for a food tray, and with the legs extended, it's perfect for working on the computer while comfortably sitting in bed or if you're sitting on the floor. It would be nice if they would add a locking device for the times you don't use the legs extended since after a few uses, the legs loosened up and don't stay completely tucked in when folded underneath the tray. But since I usually use it with the legs extended, that's not a big deal to me and I love the tray anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Snowwoman

customer_reviews.title: NICE FOR THE PRICE
customer_reviews.text: These lap tables are nice and affordable. I had two similar to these years ago. These are lighter in weight, but still sturdy and well made. Fits my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia W. Swain

customer_reviews.title: Good for short term everyday use.
customer_reviews.text: The legs are a little shorter than I would like and it’s not a heavy duty table. However, it worked well as a dinner tray and laptop tray while recuperating from surgery.
customer_reviews.author: AvidReader

customer_reviews.title: I'm really disappointed with how the legs do not stay unfolded
customer_reviews.text: I'm really disappointed with how the legs do not stay unfolded. They just hang down so anytime you are trying to move the tray, you have to physically pull them all the way out otherwise the tray will fall over. Or you would need to hold the legs in the folded position. It's just quite annoying and it makes it feel very unstable when you're eating on it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandee Paki

customer_reviews.title: Breakfast tray
customer_reviews.text: I'm so happy with this purchase. I bought this bed tray because my husband and I eat dinner in bed after a long day of work, they are really sturdy, we can cut steakes and the tray doesn't move. They are also really easy to clean, the frames are wood but the white part is actually hard plastic, so if you spill something you can just clean it really easy. and for the ladies out there I even use this to do my nails in bed. and I can also put my tablet in it. I'm really pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: YRRB

customer_reviews.title: Great Breakfast Tray
customer_reviews.text: I bought this breakfast table for my Mom who was recuperating from a broken shoulder and had a hard time joining us at the table. It not only worked great for eating but allowed her the luxury of reading a magazine or book and signing important documents. The quality is great for the price and she still continues to use it since she has healed. No assembly is required which was also a major plus for us construction challenged people. I would recommend this breakfast tray to everyone and am considering buying one for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Punkey

customer_reviews.title: Nice tables!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I usually eat dinner from our recliners and these Very well made quality bamboo tables are perfect for this. Work great for eating at your recliner or sofa with or without using the folding legs depending of your chair type. Seem to fit most recliners very well and make TV dinner a comfortable experience!
customer_reviews.author: Skyhook

customer_reviews.title: Great tray for the money! Buy this.
customer_reviews.text: These trays are a great value for the money. The design is simple and very functional. The tray is not particularly heavy so it is easy to carry and use. The small lip around the edge is enough to keep plates etc. on the tray without adding more bulk or height. The fold out legs stay tucked underneath the tray if or when they are needed. They are held in place by friction so there is not release or latch to fuss with. Great item!
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Pretty damn good tray
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my bed. Sturdy, pretty easy to fold and easy to clean. My only gripe is that some of the wood is splintered on the legs.
customer_reviews.author: James A.

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very delighted with my purchase of this product. I use it in several capacities: 1. As a conventional breakfast bed tray 2. As a tray when eating from my couch 3. As a laptop tray when sitting on my couch; almost like a portable desk It is great in all regards. Sturdy and reliable. It's not the best looking piece of furniture in the world, but for the price, I think that is to be expected. I was concerned that the product would not be sturdy enough; these concerns were unfounded. I use it regularly and am delighted with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Simit Patel

customer_reviews.title: Just what I looking for.....
customer_reviews.text: Bigger than what I expected. It's Sturdy and easy to foldable. Also reasonable price that I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Misol

customer_reviews.title: Loose legs
customer_reviews.text: A few complaints: the legs were wobbly/loose upon arrival and there's no way to tighten them (screws are inaccessible). Also, this tray lacks a mechanism for opening/unfolding the legs while you are holding the tray nor do the legs lock. You have to load things on the tray when it's fully opened/upright ... And then because the legs are loose, by the time you bring it to your destination you have to finagle the legs open again with an extra set of hands to set it down. Maddening!
customer_reviews.author: Brooklyn222

customer_reviews.title: These tables need quality control!!
customer_reviews.text: The wood has not been smoothed out, very rough. One of them has a nail sticking out. You can actually cut your hands on these tables. I have had much better ones
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great to use
customer_reviews.text: Great to make your wife surprises with the breakfast in bed! I wish my husband use this more often.
customer_reviews.author: Prilu

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy meal table with leggs or not.. while on bed or couch!
customer_reviews.text: This table is so ideal ... It's not too small ... Very well put together.. it's just right for any meal! Thank you Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Genie

customer_reviews.title: Use as a laptop desk
customer_reviews.text: This bed tray is exactly what I wanted and needed. I bought it for a "desk" for my 17-inch laptop, when I am lounging in bed. It's perfect! I read previous reviews downgrading the laminate top as just wood painted white; it is actually laminate, just not real shiny! I also read a review saying the legs were flimsy; they are just fine, they just don't lock in place, so if you move the tray, you must pick it up and move it, or else, yes, the leg(s) will fold in. As far as I'm concerned, this bed tray is absolutely perfect, and I will be using it for quite some time! THANKS!!!
customer_reviews.author: K9Claudia

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I like to eat my breakfast in bed while watching the morning news. It works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: J. Galunas

customer_reviews.title: Tried to return, very frustrating.
customer_reviews.text: Legs keep folding in. Not stable. Tried to return, only options provided we're to go to the manufacturer website which I did and got no response to my refund request, or call their customer support number which is not a valid number just got a fax tone.
customer_reviews.author: jll

customer_reviews.title: Functional and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This table is pretty and functional. Can be used as a tray, bed shelf and bed table. Love design and overall build is good. Price and quality also in equilibrium.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Boukhval

customer_reviews.title: My life has new meaning
customer_reviews.text: I do not know how I existed 34 years without this. I flippin love this lap tray/table and it was so inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Cherry

customer_reviews.title: Ready go quality
customer_reviews.text: Soo perfect for sitting in my recliner with a laptop on it or eating or crafting. Can be used with the legs down or folded.
customer_reviews.author: Mari-

customer_reviews.title: Great price, Fast shipping Thanks
customer_reviews.text: This was a very handy tray I bought for my son suffering from Brain Tumers and if we didn't put it over his lab he tell us we had forgotten the Tray. Will be talking his tray to a place that will make good use for someone else. He liked to have his hot tea in the afternoon.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia H. Barker

customer_reviews.title: Great Tray
customer_reviews.text: Great Great Great! This Bed Tray is perfect for my bedroom. I am so happy with it, the legs fold up and the surface is so nice. The tray came really fast, the packaging was really good, it came in perfect condition and best of all the price was fantastic! Not only was this a good buy, but it's sturdy and worth every nickel of the price. I would definitely recommend the seller because they got this delivered quick and in great shape. I totally love it!
customer_reviews.author: Yummy Bush

customer_reviews.title: Multiple Use Tray.
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn't call it a bed tray, that suggests limited usage. Would have liked tray top to be able to be pitchable, tilting downward slightly like ones I used to have. Otherwise are quite useful. Durable though the airlines managed to break one because they didn't replace the bubble wrap that I had on it when they did their TSA thing.
customer_reviews.author: E Smith

customer_reviews.title: It's sturdy and can hold a relative amount of wait
customer_reviews.text: It's sturdy and can hold a relative amount of wait. Just don't put all your upper body force and press down or lean down in it. You can reinforce it with a wooden bar at the bottom of it. Easy fix. i bought this to use as a laptop table as other laptop table is ridiculous priced. It works just great.
customer_reviews.author: Meera

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for my kids to use for snacks and crafts. I'd say they were worth the money, but I wish I'd found better ones. The legs are unstable and the tray falls sideways anytime you try to move it. Also, the frame itself is pretty cheaply put together. I've had to make repairs multiple times. I like the material the tray part is made of. It cleans really easily and has stood up well to my 5-year old and my 2-year old.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Welch

customer_reviews.title: now i have a set
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I would have a matching set. It was exactly what I was anticipating I'm very happy
customer_reviews.author: ann

customer_reviews.title: Rough uneven unfinished spots on wood
customer_reviews.text: I dislike the products rough uneven unfinished splotches. Ridiculous to have a new product in this condition. I have an older tray exactly like this but sanded and polished!
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking
customer_reviews.text: Good table. But the plates slide around if you don't use a cloth or other fabric underneath the plates.
customer_reviews.author: doug owen

customer_reviews.title: Simple, practical, easy & cheap
customer_reviews.text: -Exactly as described and thought it would be. Wood coloring is slightly lighter. Laminate top looks a little cheap, but you get what you pay for. Not so stylish, more basic-blah. -Nice high frame/lip so if there is a spill, it stays in they ray. It handles messes just fine, cleans just fine. -The handles/legs fold flat underneath for use as a serving tray. Fold legs down for use as a bed tray/table. Overall, simple, practical, easy.
customer_reviews.author: Isabella

product_meta.title: Winsome Wood Sherwood Bed Tray, Natural and white top
product_meta.description: Size:Pack of 1The smart and functional Sherwood Breakfast Tray with folding legs will make breakfast in bed even more special. It's constructed of Solid Wood in a Natural finish with an easy-to-clean and durable White Melamine surface. Use it for a meal in front of the TV or as a convenient workspace for your laptop. Easy to carry with raised side handles, use it as serving tray at parties. Lightweight and sturdy, the tray is perfect for concerts in the park or picnics by the lake. With legs that fold under for easy storage, the tray comes fully assembled. Dimensions of serving tray surface: 20"W x 12.2"D Folded dimensions: 21.8"W x 13.9"D x 3.3"H Clearance between legs: 22.2"W Clearance from ground to bottom of tray: 6.9"H Static weight capacity 10 lbs. No assembly required Ships in 1 box
feature_bullets: Solid wood construction with Melamine tray surface
